item.title: Darren Criss Reveals Fall Return to ‘Maybe Happy Ending’ on Broadway
item.description: While pre-planned, his return follows controversy over the casting of Andrew Barth Feldman as his temporary replacement.

item.title: Broadway’s Conrad Ricamora Starts Scholarship Fund For Asian Actors Amid Casting Controversy
item.description: The scholarship fund comes after “decades of erasure” for Asian American actors in theater, but also after a white actor was cast in Broadway’s ‘Maybe Happy Ending.’

item.title: Andrew Barth Feldman to Star in Broadway’s ‘Maybe Happy Ending’
item.description: Feldman will take over the role of Oliver from Darren Criss, who won a Tony for his portrayal.

item.title: Luigi Mangione Musical Eyes More Cities After Sold-Out San Francisco Run
item.description: The musical satirizes the real-life circumstances of Mangione being housed in the same detention center as Diddy and Sam Bankman-Fried.
